title: Nice work
comment: so far, and thank you for your time spent on making a remote for the best player out there! :)   A few things though - it would be nice if the interface could have "default android" looks or something instead of the orange theme.   Other people also mentioned browsing the library and adding music from it.   One more usability-related thing in my opinion is that the back button should actually disconnect and completely close the application instead of putting it to the background. I don't believe people simply leave the app on, but use it, change the song/volume and close it. This would help the battery life and would remove the unnecessary "settings -> disconnect" every time you want to close the app. (an easily accessible button that would disconnect + close would be fine as well);  EDIT - all fixed/implemented, 5 stars, thank you and keep it up! :-)

Thanks for your opinion. Library browsing is already done, will be included in the next version! For the other points, please post them here: https://code.google.com/p/clementine-remote-android/issues/list

title: Great app!
comment: I love the simple intuitive interface. There is always room for improvement, but 5 stars nonetheless. P. S. you can probably connect to hostname instead of ip, works for me!

title: Great app!
comment: Don't forget to allow port in the firewall

title: Works great
comment: Had to disable the firewall to connect, overall it's nice.

title: Great so far
comment: Only thing I am really missing is switch songs trough the notifications.
It is implemented in the new version! It will come soon :)

title: A limited but great app
comment: The Clementine app for Android is pretty great but it's missing one thing (as others have mentioned) - being able to access your entire library instead of just playlists, which honestly is huge. I don't think editing or tagging or deleting should be in the Android app, but just being able to see and load tracks/albums from the library would be amazing.  I also know this is a bigger task than most people realize.   I commend the developers and I understand that everyone wants something more, but if this functionality was added this would be a six star app.  The only other thing I can think of is a virtual volume control instead of using the rocker on my tablet (after a while those have to give out...virtual would be better).  Anyway, for a free app this is pretty amazing. For those who don't have definitely it try it out (it's free).
Library browsing is already implemented, wait for the next version! :-)
Great

title: Love it
comment: Clementine is my preferred player from almost 3 years, even from my desktop machine with Ubuntu to my MacBook Pro. Now with this app I can get what I always think to get: control over the player from my mobile device. Thank you Clementine team!

title: Best app ever
comment: Awesomest app.

Please create a suggestion here: http://code.google.com/p/clementine-remote-android/issues/list
Connecting via internet works, you have do deaktivate "private ips only" in Clemetine and forward port 5500 in your router.

title: Lovin' this already.
comment: Great job.

title: Almost Great!!
comment: I have never used a remote for playing songs but from this i can see that its useful and the best available
I love it. If this could open the media library then would be perfect. Great job!

title: Good start
comment: A very good start. Eagerly awaiting new features.

title: Good addition!
comment: Great app, needs acess to media library in the future but it's on the right path!
Library access will come in the next version! :-)

title: Works As Advertised
comment: It took a bit to connect, otherwise I'd give it a 5. I finally had success with one of the 3 IP addresses (???) shown in Clementine's preferences. One handy feature would be a volume control, otherwise it's kind of cool.

Just hit the volume buttons on your phone while the app is open, you can change the volume with that. Regarding the ip adresses, you likely have more than one network interface (wifi, ethernet, virtual box, etc.) and Clementine cannot tell which one you have to use on your phone.

title: Great app!
comment: Does what it says on the tin. Clementine is the cats meow! Highly recommended!

title: Good app
comment: For the first release, this app is good enough

title: Impressive!
comment: The Clementine project never ceases to amaze. The application is well-written, works out of the box, and allows me to change the playlist from the couch. Amazing!

title: Why can't I access my library?
comment: The most obvious feature this should have, but doesn't, is the ability to access your entire library. Only having access to play lists I've already made is very restrictive. Shouldn't accessing artist/album menus be the primary purpose of this app?
The primary purpose of this app is to remote control the player, not managing playlists etc. But library browsing is on the todo list and will come in the future.

title: Almost perfect!
comment: Great app. I've been looking for a way to control Clementine from my phone for a while now. This is much simpler than the workarounds I've used so far. The app lets you download songs and albums to your mobile phone, which is a great idea - bravo for that. It would get 5 stars from me if I could rate the songs from my phone - the only feature that I miss.
Rating a song will come in the next version :-)

title: Excellent!
comment: Could always have a couple more features, such as remote delete (I like pruning my library), but it definitely gets the job done :-)

title: Awesome
comment: Works flawlessly. Downloading tracks is a killer feature. Bravo to the developer!

title: Great idea but ...
comment: Clementine Remote is very useful app but couple features are missing. e.g. I like to change color or theme of background but i can`t.  Also I have connection issues.  I can connect to Clementine after few minutes only (firewall is set correctly). A track progress bar jumps from 0:00 to current track position, sometimes is frozen and  sometimes it`s work smoothly.

title: Almost there
comment: Guys! GREAT App, I love the Download option is perfect for my MTP Android Device

title: Rad start!
comment: The big buttons and UI are nice. Things work pretty well and I can see this being awesome.  A few things are missing yet to make it complete, but having a clementine icon on my android seems right.    To state the obvious wishlist:  It would be nice to be able to load other playlists and other library sources from the app or search the library.   Pull down pause and play control instead of opening the app first.

title: Excelent
comment: An excelent addon to the Clementine player. Works nicely with both the linux and windows version of Clementine.

title: Works great!
comment: Great app!  Using it with my Ubuntu setups, no problem!  Very cool, thanks AMU!

title: Brilliant
comment: Fantastic app.  Running on Linux too.

title: Perfect
comment: Good job...never expected this app

title: Ivo Karadzhov
comment: Works perfectly! Easy to use and serves its purpose very well! As usual Clementine delivers! I strongly recommend this one!

title: Very cool!!
comment: I've been using Clementine for a while now on both my Windows and Linux machines and the addition of the Remote Control app for Android is simply brilliant!   Very easy to set up and very nicely implemented. I often have several playlists open, this app even downloads those so switching between tracks from different playlists just works!   Big thumbs up and a big thanks to the devs! Great job.

title: Love this app!
comment: Guys, thank you very much for such a player and this great app - very convenient, fast and pretty :) Keep up good work!

title: Excellent !
comment: Works great. Very fast, nice and Clementine is the best crossplatform player I found.

title: Very convenient
comment: Would be 5 stars if it allowed library search

title: Nice idea
comment: I have turned from windows environment, and this is the best app of this kind for Linux, but my the highest wish is to make it functional as remote controller for foobar2000 from windows. And it crashes very often,(android 4.2.2 it happens often when I press "next" button) and each time I switching to this app it again downloads the details of now played song and playlist. I don't want to give low rate because I see it growing up. Good luck
Thanks for the comment. I release a new version in the next couple of days which should fix your bugs. Thanks for your patience!

title: great app but could use a few more features.
comment: This is by far the best app out there for controlling your music player from your phone and works great on linux.   The app still crashes from time to time but it is not really a big deal.   I would have given 5 stars if it would be possible to access the library and make new playlists. Nevertheless this is a fantastic app.

title: Nice app
comment: Works as said. Can't beat the price. Wish there was a way to explore the library and add to playlist. Keep up the good work. Thanks (system: Samsung ACE & Ubuntu)

title: Good app
comment: Fast and slick -  other remotes and players often have a delay.  Great for parties and pre - made playlists, though it would be nice to download the library metadat. Can work around this with a "full library" playlist.

title: work perfectly
comment: A long time I look for the way to management clementine in my Debian Wheezy from my android and with this app I archieve it. I'm really excited

title: Fantastic !
comment: Works so well that it's difficult to believe it. Looks incredible too. Wish the Ubuntu one music app looks anything like that Very impressed by the ability to change the volume using my phone volume buttons  Would love to see the library now, not just the last playlist

title: Really cool
comment: Great idea. App works fine, I like it. Volume control started to work after I just reenabled it in the app settings. Thank you, good work.

title: Great
comment: My favourite music player. Thank you.

title: Mint issue (with workaround)
comment: I instaled this app on Galaxy S4 and latest Raring amd64 on Linux Mint 15 and the player on my pc stopped working. It just doesn't start playing any song or radio  !!!! Workaround - after deleting ~/.config/Clementine/ it works again
Please send me a detailed report here: http://goo.gl/RLfokk

title: I switched to Clementine Player because of this remote control.
comment: Clean interface and very handy.   The developer responds very quickly with help.   I have tried four other remote controls and many other music players.  After I tried this one.  I deleted the others and switched to Clementine.
Clementine just keeps getting better and better
Very nice app

title: Excellent
comment: Thanks, now I can finally control my music when lying in bed :) Does exactly what it's supposed to do, bugs get fixed in a timely manner. Great experience!

title: Fantastic
comment: Just the app I needed for my favourite player. Keep up the good work :-)

title: Works great.
comment: The integration isn't as good as with iTunes. But I'm glad its there. It needs the ability to add to the queue from library. Use more holo so it matches Android more.

title: Wow
comment: I was SO amazed this existed when I threw together a super-setup in my room! Now it is %100 hands-free and matches perfectly with ProjectM visuilizations on main TV output without having to close the window! Amazing and almost perfect!

title: Awesome
comment: The best music player just gets better! Thank you!

title: This is great.
comment: Updated review.  Still need to know u need a specific build, but it really a great start.  Keep up the good work!  Better access to available music would be nice.  And I think the volume numeric indicator may get out of sync with the actual player, but no big deal.  this is one of my fav apps.  Thanks!
Thanks for the updated review :)

title: Amazing
comment: i just cant believe it.... thank you guys..!!!

title: Great project
comment: Need some features such as author/genre filtering and playlist selection but definitely on the right track. It's great to see open source apps in the market. Five stars,  just Keep up with the development

title: Can't get it to work with OSx
comment: The documentation I've found for this states: The remote control is disabled by default. You have to active it in the settings first. Go to the Settings and select the "Network Remote" item.  From the instructions we have to assume they mean setting in Clementine on your computer not the app on your Android. On a Mac there is no "Settings" we have "Preferences", and there is no "Network Remote" item located anywhere.  In general the documentation Clementine offers is poor which is typical of an open source app.  Note I am using Clementine v1.1

I assume you are using a stable Clementine version like 1.0 or 1.1. It doesn't work with these versions! Download the newest build from here in order to use the remote: http://builds.clementine-player.org/

title: Awesome app
comment: This is awesome! Exactly what I've been waiting for. Keep up the great work, guys! :)
Thanks :)

title: Great work!
comment: Best player and i'm loving this remote control!  GPL V3 Free as in freedom!

title: Good Just Needs A Couple More Features
comment: Those Features is actually make it a music player and have remote sync

title: Clementine got a remote :)
comment: Hell yeah guys, good job !  Whatever the next functionality coming up is, I'm so glad to find such toy :)

title: Really good remote
comment: Really pleasing remote, love the auto connect function. There are 3 things I would love to see: 1. Remove the sound when you control the volume using the phones volume rocker (like in xbmc remote).  2. A setting to hide the track number under playlist.  3. Alphabetical quick scrolling in playlist.

Hi, i'm glad you like my app. 1. I removed the beep sound when changing the volume in the next version. 2. Good idea, i'll make it as an option for the next version. 3. Not yet planned some kind of sorting, maybe in a future version. Greetings.

title: Very nice!
comment: Great app. Looks good, works well. Is missing library browsing as many others have mentioned, but a solid start. Thank you!

title: Recommended
comment: Whoever wants to escape itunes can come to Clementine and with this remote,  one gap more is closed.  Now I'm only missing the selection possibility from entire library with artist,  album,  genre etc selections.

title: Brilliant!
comment: Its working brilliantly and I'm waiting for the new features that will be added.

title: Happy!
comment: Happy to be able to control clementine from phone. Typing this as Dronezone on somafm luls me to sleep :) zzzzzz

title: A Good Start
comment: This is a good looking remote that is easy to use, but is missing a couple key features. I would like to able to navigate the entire library and rate tracks. This shouldn't stop anyone from installing, though, as this is a very good start.

title: Very cool.
comment: Works awesomely. The only thing I'd like to see added from here is being able to view the lyrics that Clementine pulls from the net. Then it would be perfect in my opinion.

title: Works great as a remote
comment: Love the lock screen controls. All this app is missing is library browsing.

title: Hmmm
comment: Couldnt make it run... The app insists it cannot find the host...

title: Good but needs improvement
comment: I give it 4 stars for being under the GPL and because it seems to be working quite well. What I really think needs to be implemented is a playlist search function.

title: Wonderful!
comment: Works wonderfully, would love library view and support in the future.

title: Very cool! :)
comment: Simple, to the point, awesome :)

title: Works
comment: Would use playlist view tho

title: Good app
comment: Look great and easy to use! I recommend you to try it.  Negative point: We cannot see the whole playlist and we can't add new songs to the current playlist.

title: Awesome
comment: The app looks great guys, I especially like it that I can control the volume with the volume control on my phone.
